Using your memory will make it stronger. What can you do to practice recalling things from memory, without first looking at any notes?

Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1–6, identify a quadratic function in standard form, \(f(x)\), with the given zeros.

  1. 1 and 9

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.11.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 − 10x + 9\).

  1. \(\sqrt5\) and \(-\sqrt{5}\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 8.11.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 − 5\).

  1. –7

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.11.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 + 14x + 49\).

  1. Examine the graph below to identify the zeros of the function. Then, write a quadratic function in standard form with the given zeros.

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 8.11.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 + 4x − 5\).

  1. –3

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.11.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 + 6x + 9\).

  1. Examine the graph below to identify the zeros of the function. Then, write a quadratic function in standard form with the given zeros.

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 8.11.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(f(x) = x^2 − 6x + 8\).

  1. Write the specific quadratic function, \(p(x)\), in standard form, that has the zeros –8 and 3 and passes through the point \((2, -20)\).

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.11.3 and 8.11.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(p(x) = 2x^2 + 10x − 48\).

  1. Write the specific quadratic function, \(g(x)\), in standard form, that has the zero 2 and passes through the point \((3, -3)\).

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activities 8.11.3 and 8.11.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(g(x) = −3x^2 + 12x − 12\).

  1. Write the specific quadratic function, \(h(x)\), in standard form, that has the zeros 3 and 5 and passes through the point \((2, 12)\).

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.11.3 and 8.11.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(h(x) = 4x^2 − 32x + 60\).

  1. Write the specific quadratic function, \(w(x)\), in standard form, that has the zeros 6 and –7 and passes through the point \((5, 12)\).

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activities 8.11.3 and 8.11.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \( w(x) = −x^2 − x + 42\).
